page.title: 05 SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: "I think it is very sad that it has taken so long for the Long Sutton by-pass to be built and I think the people have every right to feel we have been 'leap-frogged' both by Terrington St. Clements and Crowland. I think our town needed a by-pass just as much, if not more, and I think it is caused one or two of the problems that had the by-pass been here they would have been avoided. Already such things as the depot, which is giving concern in Swapcoat Lane and now problems for the proposed new primary school, would have probably been sited near the by-pass which would have been better for everybody. I think the whole planning for the district is centered round when and where the by-pass will be."
